Summary

### Expected Result

`spack install mfem` builds successfully.

### Actual Result

`spack install mfem` fails to build

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
# Assumes hypre hasn't yet been installed
$ spack install mfem
# hypre should be mandatory
```

### Information on your system

This spack installation is on RZTopaz, which I believe is running RHEL7. I'm using the default configuration, but did run `spack compiler find`, which found GCC 4.9.3 successfully.

The errors I see look like

```console
/collab/usr/gapps/librom/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/openmpi-3.0.1-mag6eiw5hvarj2johuj4dbx3locaxxma/bin/mpic++  -O3 -I/collab/usr/gapps/librom/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/hypre\
-2.14.0-r2ndcvyvdfp4qtqhm244zg5hyojd4xfr/include -I/collab/usr/gapps/librom/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/metis-5.1.0-vlsznfyilnoevbrbt72f3262kjxvo4kz/include  -I/collab/usr/gapps/librom/spack/op\
t/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.9.3/netcdf-4.4.1.1-2t22niwuxdtodgu3a4gh2rbagyec2mt6/include  -c fem/pgridfunc.cpp -o fem/pgridfunc.o

 >> 129    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:209:68: error: macro "hypre_CTAlloc" requires 3 arguments, but only 2 given
     130        HYPRE_Real *eliminate_row = hypre_CTAlloc(HYPRE_Real, diag_nrows);
     131                                                                        ^
  >> 132    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:210:68: error: macro "hypre_CTAlloc" requires 3 arguments, but only 2 given
     133        HYPRE_Real *eliminate_col = hypre_CTAlloc(HYPRE_Real, offd_ncols);
     134                                                                        ^
  >> 135    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:239:71: error: macro "hypre_CTAlloc" requires 3 arguments, but only 2 given
     136                                                                 num_sends));
     137                                                                           ^
  >> 138    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:271:70: error: macro "hypre_CTAlloc" requires 3 arguments, but only 2 given
     139        offd_cols_to_elim = hypre_CTAlloc(HYPRE_Int, num_offd_cols_to_elim);
     140                                                                          ^
  >> 141    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:272:69: error: macro "hypre_CTAlloc" requires 3 arguments, but only 2 given
     142        eliminate_coefs = hypre_CTAlloc(HYPRE_Real, num_offd_cols_to_elim);
     143                                                                         ^
  >> 144    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:287:24: error: macro "hypre_TFree" requires 2 arguments, but only 1 given
     145        hypre_TFree(buf_data);
     146                            ^
  >> 147    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:288:29: error: macro "hypre_TFree" requires 2 arguments, but only 1 given
     148        hypre_TFree(eliminate_row);
     149                                 ^
  >> 150    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:289:29: error: macro "hypre_TFree" requires 2 arguments, but only 1 given
     151        hypre_TFree(eliminate_col);
     152                                 ^
  >> 153    linalg/hypre_parcsr.cpp:306:33: error: macro "hypre_TFree" requires 2 arguments, but only 1 given
     154        hypre_TFree(offd_cols_to_elim);
# Similar compile-time errors continue for many more lines
```

My guess is that mfem 3.3.2 is meant to be built with a specific version range of hypre. The current default version of hypre installed by spack is 2.14.0, as of commit `82ac1571c227adb0af665332396b9b3afff5853f`.
title: `spack install mfem` installs hypre 2.14.0 by default, then throws hypre-related compile-time errors in building mfem
